commands.description: list who has access to an app
commands.help:
Usage: heroku access [flags]

list who has access to an app

Flags:
 -a, --app APP        app to run command against
 -r, --remote REMOTE  git remote of app to use
 --json               output in json format
helpLine: list who has access to an app

commands.help:
Usage: heroku sharing:access

This command is now heroku access

commands.description: Add new users to your app
commands.help:
Usage: heroku access:add EMAIL [flags]

Add new users to your app

Flags:
 -a, --app APP              app to run command against
 -r, --remote REMOTE        git remote of app to use
 --permissions PERMISSIONS  list of permissions comma separated

Examples:

    heroku access:add user@email.com --app APP # Add a collaborator to your app
    heroku access:add user@email.com --app APP --permissions deploy,manage,operate # permissions must be comma separated
helpLine: Add new users to your app

commands.help:
Usage: heroku sharing:add

this command is now heroku access:add

commands.description: Remove users from your app
commands.help:
Usage: heroku access:remove EMAIL [flags]

Remove users from your app

Flags:
 -a, --app APP        app to run command against
 -r, --remote REMOTE  git remote of app to use

Example:

    heroku access:remove user@email.com --app APP

Usage: heroku sharing:remove

this command is now heroku access:remove

commands.description: Update existing collaborators in an org app
commands.help:
Usage: heroku access:update EMAIL [flags]

Update existing collaborators in an org app

Flags:
 -a, --app APP              app to run command against
 -r, --remote REMOTE        git remote of app to use
 --permissions PERMISSIONS  comma-delimited list of permissions to update
                            (deploy,manage,operate)

Example:

    heroku access:update user@email.com --app APP --permissions deploy,manage,operate
helpLine: Update existing collaborators in an org app

commands.description: add yourself to an organization app
commands.help:
Usage: heroku apps:join [flags]

add yourself to an organization app

Flags:

 -r, --remote REMOTE  git remote of app to use
helpLine: add yourself to an organization app

commands.description: prevent organization members from joining an app
commands.help:
Usage: heroku apps:lock [flags]

prevent organization members from joining an app

Flags:
 -a, --app APP        app to run command against
 -r, --remote REMOTE  git remote of app to use
helpLine: prevent organization members from joining an app

commands.description: prevent organization members from joining an app
commands.help:
Usage: heroku lock [flags]

prevent organization members from joining an app

Flags:
 -a, --app APP        app to run command against
 -r, --remote REMOTE  git remote of app to use
helpLine: prevent organization members from joining an app

commands.description: transfer applications to another user or team
commands.help:
Usage: heroku apps:transfer RECIPIENT [flags]

transfer applications to another user or team

RECIPIENT  user or team to transfer applications to

Flags:
 -a, --app APP        app to run command against
 -l, --locked         lock the app upon transfer
 -r, --remote REMOTE  git remote of app to use
 --bulk               transfer applications in bulk

Examples:

    $ heroku apps:transfer collaborator@example.com
    Transferring example to collaborator@example.com... done

    $ heroku apps:transfer acme-widgets
    Transferring example to acme-widgets... done

    $ heroku apps:transfer --bulk acme-widgets
    ...
helpLine: transfer applications to another user or team

commands.help:
Usage: heroku sharing:transfer

this command is now heroku apps:transfer

commands.description: unlock an app so any organization member can join
commands.help:

unlock an app so any organization member can join

Flags:
 -a, --app APP        app to run command against
 -r, --remote REMOTE  git remote of app to use
helpLine: unlock an app so any organization member can join

commands.description: unlock an app so any organization member can join

commands.description: list members of an organization or a team
commands.help:
Usage: heroku members [flags]

list members of an organization or a team

Flags:
 -r, --role ROLE  filter by role
 --json           output in json format
 --pending        filter by pending team invitations
helpLine: list members of an organization or a team

commands.description: adds a user to an organization or a team
commands.help:
Usage: heroku members:add EMAIL [flags]

adds a user to an organization or a team

Flags:
 -r, --role ROLE  member role (admin, collaborator, member, owner)
helpLine: adds a user to an organization or a team

commands.description: sets a members role in an organization or a team
commands.help:
Usage: heroku members:set EMAIL [flags]

sets a members role in an organization or a team

Flags:
 -r, --role ROLE  member role (admin, collaborator, member, owner)
helpLine: sets a members role in an organization or a team

commands.description: removes a user from an organization or a team
commands.help:
Usage: heroku members:remove EMAIL

removes a user from an organization or a team
helpLine: removes a user from an organization or a team

commands.description: list the organizations that you are a member of
commands.help:
Usage: heroku orgs [flags]

list the organizations that you are a member of

Flags:
 --enterprise  filter by enterprise orgs
 --json        output in json format
 --teams       filter by teams
helpLine: list the organizations that you are a member of

commands.help: Usage: heroku orgs:default

commands.description: open the organization interface in a browser window
commands.help:
Usage: heroku orgs:open

open the organization interface in a browser window
helpLine: open the organization interface in a browser window

commands.description: list the teams that you are a member of
commands.help:
Usage: heroku teams [flags]

list the teams that you are a member of

Flags:
 --json  output in json format
helpLine: list the teams that you are a member of
